name: The Wyndham Midtown 45

reviews.text: The staff are very friendly. The location is great. The rooms are clean, modern and comfortable.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a city break

reviews.text: There is a great comfort diner across the road for breakfast.
reviews.title: Decent hotel, but not for everyone

reviews.text: Wifi is not free $15 for 24hr.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel, excellent location

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to friends.
reviews.title: Lovely stay at The Alex

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First impressions: The lobby is extremely compact but rooms are larger than one might expect in midtown. My sense is that anyone complaining about the size of the rooms hasn't spent much time in midtown hotels. Check-in was someone chaotic due to the limited space in the lobby, but I was checking in at check-out time and they were able to find a room despite my early arrival.
reviews.title: A bit tired in places

reviews.text: Just stayed at the Alex last week. The location was excellent. The price was good. The hotel was clean and generally in good order.
reviews.title: Good Location & Price, No Sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, I stayed on the 4th floor right next to the elevator. The walls are paper thin - heard the elevator ding constantly. I was apparently across the hall from some sort of housekeeping closet. The street noise was extremely loud - no fault of the hotel, but the housekeeping staff was so loud and just rude. Door slamming, loud talking from the early hours until the time I left at 9 am. At 8:45, housekeeping was banging on the door. Unfortunately, all the positives outweigh the fact that I couldn't get any sleep!
reviews.title: Have people who stay here and written reviews ever stayed in a real 4star hotel ...?

reviews.text: Just back from the Alex.....I have been to New York many times and stayed in some fab hotels....such as the Waldorf ....etc... However we decided to go on last minute treat and wanted little boutique number hoping to have wee cheapie break...Thomas cook had a three star but I chose to upgrade to a four star at additional cost of 500 quid ...hey ho of we go and arrived at the Alex on 6th Feb ....I was worried as I'd read some of the reviews on trip advisor so was mildly reassured when we arrived ....the foyer was small as quoted but bar was intimate tho tables dirty and badly marked with ring marks....our room wasn't ready but we happy to embrace a New York minute.....and have a drink....my partner had a drink while I decided to speak to reception and upgrade to a suite thinking if I paid more I'd get better .....my partners first time in New York I wanted to be special for him....The staff as quoted earlier were very friendly and she kindly took a further 200 dollars for a suite upgrade with a view ......we got to our suite....a kitchen which I didn't need and a great view of the Chrysler thru dirty curtains and I mean dirty ....the windows weren't much better ....carpets were stained and grubby yet bathroom and sheets very clean .....the hotel fairly central which was handy as we there due Nemo snow blizzard and could easily walk round, nite of snow storm we ate in hotel....very basic menu tho nicer than expected, but meal for two and a mediocre bottle of merlot 200 dollars......next morning pot of coffee and tea for two 29 dollars and 5 dollar tip.....I kid you not ....we didn't do tea in morning again.....atmosphere very nice tho and this redeemed hotels shabby and unloved rooms.....until we ask for a late checkout....they charged me 140 dollars plus taxes....for extra three hours ,we could stay in room for free to two pm ......actually was only 2hours I was stuck in the bijoux bathroom after the lock went on door...again maintenance men were apologetic and empathetic to my plight but a tired old hotel wasn't to be blamed on them....all in all a very expensive 4 nites in anything but luxury...grubby and tired.....sori ....staff lovely but that we're it stops ....could have stayed in five star for same price ....
reviews.title: Why is this not rated #1

reviews.text: Our stay at The Alex was the best. We were pleasantly surprised with the overall hotel: room, friendly & helpful staff...absolutely loved it. Best part of the room, the T.v. In the bathroom. We booked at the last minute amd didn't have time to research so again, we were very happy. We did not have the opportunity to check out the other ameneties but I'm sure they were nice too. Only downfall for our room...the remote was a little faulty.
reviews.title: What makes it a 4 star?

reviews.text: The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, great location, but I really don't get what makes it a 4-star hotel. There was no coffee/tea in the room, 3 of the 5 lamps didn't work (2 were immediately fixed, 1 was missing a light bulb they didn't have on site), the phone didn't work (was fixed). No kitchenette in our room. So for the price and location it was OK, but more like a 3-star place.
reviews.title: Amazing Amazing Amazing
Great hotel in midtown
reviews.text: Stayed there many times, great for work or a short break. The gym is nothing special, there are better equipped. The rooms are well equipped, tv in the bathroom is a nice touch, plenty of tv channels and you get some good views. The double rooms are very good, ideal for a family break
Stayed here, as we required a 2 bedroom suite. We only had 1 bathroom, so be sure to clarify if you need 2, as they do exist at this hotel.
reviews.title: 2 bedroom suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The furnishings are a little odd in the living room - the couch and chair are made for smaller people that we are! Yet the dining chairs were somewhat oversized. Anyway, it was sufficient for our 5 night stay. The curtains are very heavy and held onto cigarette smoke. This was mentioned to the staff and freshened before we returned that evening.
reviews.title: Garage Sale Furniture

reviews.text: Walking to Times Square is only about 10 mins. I quite liked the neighbourhood that this hotel is in. The Amish Market up the street was great for fresh food, and the new deli on the corner came in handy. The Irish bar next door was a little too convenient some nights with their outdoor terrace upstairs!
reviews.title: Convienent and Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, if you're looking for a 2 bedroom suite, then this hotel offers it with a good location and a good amount of space for you already stretched NYC dollar.
reviews.title: NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the Alex to be a good hotel for a week long trip to New York in August. Couldn't fault the hotel or the staff who were without exception friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Good value at the Alex Hotel

reviews.text: In hindsight it proved to be a little further away from the hustle and bustle of Broadway and Central Park then we would have ideally liked, but it was certainly within walking distance of most popular areas of interest and very close to Grand Central and the subway. If you want peace and quite, this is a the place for you.
reviews.title: Smart upscale boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Didn't eat at the hotel - but we found a lack of reasonable restaurants in the near vicinity and often walked up to Bryant Park or nearby to eat.
reviews.title: Adored the Alex Hotel in Manhattan

reviews.text: Likes - clean rooms, friendly and knowledgeable staff.
reviews.title: Great Base In New York & Super Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Disliked - having to pay for internet access in the room. In this day and age this should really be free.
reviews.title: Love this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: The Alex was great!

likes.disliked: — I cant complain about it at all!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: *Great Location without being in too touristy location
reviews.title: Nice place with attentive staff

reviews.text: *Easily accessible to subways
reviews.title: 5 Star Service

likes.disliked: — Wireless internet in the room is expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: *Very sheik modern designed rooms with TVs in the bathroom
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: *Tons of Parking available in the area.
reviews.title: Excellent place

reviews.text: Overall an excellent hotel with good rates. We read to ask for a front facing room and that is what we did. We were not disapointed. Really great size... nice style. Very comfortable beds and pillows. Only one complaint with the room... The toilet... Not the bathroom... Specificaly the toilet. The flush button was recessed in the wall and was cumbersome to push. (It looked like the backup flusher on an automatic toilet.) And when you did flush it was VERY loud. But hey... if that is the worst problem... I can't complain.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Alex on business while in NYC. This is a good, clean, accessible hotel, however I won't stay here again.
reviews.title: Tidy and Clean but Lacking Atmosphere
Big rooms in the Big Apple...
reviews.text: Although in a good location it is lacking any form of atmosphere. There is no wireless internet access and you are charged $15 per 24 hours to use a cable?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym is also pretty old fashioned.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel!

reviews.text: The staff were very pleasant, attentive and helpful. However there was constantly people knocking on my door - not allowing me any peace. Trying to give me ice, sort my phone..? None of which I had issues with. I also had to tell 3 cleaners that I had a late check-out.
reviews.title: Low-key Elegance!

likes.liked: — The cool interior design of the Hotel
likes.disliked: — It was all very professional. No problems.

reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. We are frequent visitors to NYC. We requested 2 beds. When we entered the room, there was only the 1 full size bed! We requested to be moved to what we asked for originally. They moved us. The refrigerator in the room didn't work, but someone came and replaced it. We left the next morning, came back at 3 and the room still hadn't been cleaned. After several calls, they said they would come and clean it. We had to leave and when we came back at 9pm, there were no replacement towels, we were left with 1 towel for the both of us. The bathroom hadn't been cleaned. The carpet hadn't been vacuumed. When we checked out, we were charged for a movie we didn't order, but they credited us after we complained. Wifi was priced at a ridiculous $15 a day! We've stayed at midtown hotels for half the price, free wifi and free breakfast. We won't be coming back to The Alex.
reviews.title: You can get better service at the YMCA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Alex over President's Day weekend, had an executive suite. The space is good. Furniture is worn out. There was a kitchen but it didn't really have anything to cook with - 2 pots, not enough silverware for more than 2, and not even a coffee maker or toaster or anything. The room wasn't that clean - the microwave was full of crumbs, there was a pack of cigarettes in the kitchen drawer, it was not vacuumed during our stay. The TVs are fuzzy. The worst was the water pressure - it comes in waves, from nothing to normal pressure. There was a lot of noise outside the room - in some cases guests leaving, in other cases the hotel staff. This place could be really good with just a little work - replace the furniture, tvs, and provide basics in the kitchens. And fix the water pressure - the most bizzarre part of the entire stay! Staff was friendly though, except for the person who brought the car and didn't help with the luggage. Door staff, desk staff generally very nice.
reviews.title: Could be a lot better with a little work...
Major fail in service and attention to detail
reviews.text: Despite having stayed here before and enjoyed the hotel in the past, it seems that the service and general condition of the hotel has taken a significant dive. Too many small details and issues to deal with e.g. missing appliances in the kitchen, furniture in bad conditions, TV's that barely work and an appalling wifi coverage. Not cool when you are trying to get work done. I sent a note to the manager with direct feedback and a request to sort a few things out with the room. only half of it was fixed and I never heard a word back from anyone. I travel a lot and stay at many different hotels. I don't think i am coming back here. Just not worth the hassle and a real shame as it used to be a great hotel

The staff and very nice and professional in the hotel and responsive when called and the restaurant staff were efficient too. However this is all let down by the shabby rooms, with loose fixtures and fittings, water marks on furniture, inadequate space in the bathroom, bins not emptied in the room and dirty net curtains and an unnecessary $15 wifi charge. The only redeeming feature was a clean and comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Good location but tired and dated rooms

reviews.text: I often stay at the Hotel Alex on business and have reviewed this hotel several times in the past. The hotel is under new management and unfortunately my recent experiences there have been very disappointing. I will highlight two areas: service and maintenance.
reviews.title: New Managment Equals Changes fo rthe Worse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed five nights in The Alex in midtown New York. I thought that it was a great hotel and it is located in a very interesting and fashionable part of the city. Since the hotel is very close to Grand Central Station, it is easy to get to other parts of the city. We were given a spacious studio room which was very well equipped. It even had a small dishwashing machine, a microwave and a CD player. The hotel staff were friendly and efficent. It is an outstnding hotel that I would recommend highly to anyone visiting New York.. .
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location

reviews.text: We stayed at The Alex from 14-24 August this year and had a 2 bed/2 bath suite on the 16th floor. Our suite was situated at the front and offered great views of the Chrysler Building as well as 45th/3rd. This was our first family holiday in the US and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Our daughters shared a room and had their own bathroom, which was ideal! Furniture was a bit dated here and there and some light fittings and door handles could have done with some maintenance, but overall we were very pleased with our suite. Wifi cost 15 dollars/24 hours and was sometimes slow, but moving the laptop to a different corner of the living space helped! Staff were all very friendly. Hotel is within walking distance of UN Building, Grand Central Terminal and Bryant Park (what a find!) and - a short distance further - Times Square. We would certainly book this hotel again!
reviews.title: Recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As soon as we walked into the lobby we knew we were in trouble. Smelly hallway, smelly room and banged up furniture like I've never seen in a hotel. See picture. Event afer our very late arrive we when out walking to find a new hotel. or is it that we had the worst room in the hotel???
reviews.title: Very poor

reviews.text: I would never recommend this hotel. OK there is a kitchen maybe that was the only positive.
reviews.title: we saw Beyonce in the elevator

reviews.text: We stayed here about 3 years ago and my daughter recognized Beyonce in the elevator. I would not have, but I will say that she was beautiful to look at. The bar had alot of would be "rap stars" hanging around drinking expensive champagne and looking very hip. and therefore making me look unhip. The rooms are pretty nice, flat screen, and rooms have an oriental feel to them. We got a deal on the stay through expedia and would not have stayed if we had to pay the regular tarif.
reviews.title: Great choice for first-time stay in New York!

reviews.text: I had often stayed at The Alex with no problem. On my last trip when checking out I was told to leave my luggage in my room for the bellhop to put in the luggage room as my flight was a few hours later. When I collected my luggage later I discovered my iPad was missing.
reviews.title: Watch your valuables!

reviews.text: The Alex management later told me they had filed a report with their insurer and I would hear from the insurance. I am still waiting two weeks later. Repeated phone calls to the management. produce no results. i am disgusted with this hotel and would advise strongly against staying there.
reviews.title: Best place to stay in NYC!

reviews.text: What a find this hotel is! The location is perfect, easy to get to most any where and the neighborhood is great after a long day of work. The hotel is wonderfully appointed with all you need plus a few extras that push it over the top...like fitness room and great lounge to unwind. The staff during our recent stay was fabulous. From doormen, to desk staff to housekeeping every one was friendly and welcoming...thank you to security who were polite and gave an extra feeling of comfort.
reviews.title: A good stay in a good hotel

reviews.text: Want to head to NYC but aren’t fussy about what hotel you are staying at so long it is clean and has comfortable beds? Well, The Alex is more than that: with views onto the Chrysler building, two blocks from Grand Central station and exceptionally pleasant staff this mid-town hotel doesn’t make you miss the hip designer hotels. I was gate-crashing my husband’s business trip and wasn’t involved in the choice of hotel. Unlike me, all my husband wants is to be as close as possible to his NY office and doesn’t care about the coolest hotel lobby or best view or bar. A comfy bed and proximity to his office were his criteria and I have to say this attitude gets you a lot in NYC. At least at The Alex. So, the decor doesn’t aim to win design awards but it is neutral, well thought through and comfortable. The hotel food is OK and not too pricey, but there are many nearby options, so you are not stuck with the hotel menu. Most rooms provide for an extended stay with in-built kitchens, dining table and lounge area. We were staying on the 28th floor but the wi-fi didn't reach up all the way, so the hotel staff gave me another hotel room on the 3rd floor to work from. For that i am giving them a huge golden star for resourcefulness and helpfulness. So my main point is, if you remove all your fussiness about style, design and 'where to be seen' attitude, then at The Alex you can get a nice sized suite for the price of a standard room in one of those hipster downtown hotels. Plus it has probably the nicest and most attentive staff in town.
reviews.title: NYC

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great a great position to travel and explore the city. The entrance is rather small and check in took a little while. Our room was very good & also very clean. Views were good of the streets below and although we were above the main road there was little or no noise. The beds were very good and the room maintained well. The staff were friendly & helpful in all our dealings with them. Bar was on the pricey side so we drank in the pub next door. I do think this hotel lives up to its star rating and would stay again.
reviews.title: Nice NY hotel, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights at The Alex Hotel. It was part of our Honeymoon. Every hotel that we stayed at offered us something to say "Congratulations on your marriage"- either a room upgrade or a complimentary bottle of wine. The Alex hotel offered us nothing- not even a verbal message when checking in.
reviews.title: Basic

reviews.text: The rooms are very basic. The furniture is old-fashioned. The view from the room is awful. i was never able to see the Chrysler building from anywhere in the hotel.
reviews.title: Two Bedroomed Apartment with Fantastic View of Chrysler Building!

reviews.text: The staff are indifferent and not very helpful, especially the staff at the reception. the gentlemen outside were usually helpful if they were in a good mood. the bathroom amenities are not replenished after the first night.
reviews.title: Great Staff, Great Room
Very poor value indeed
reviews.text: Overall i would recommend this hotel only if you require a place to bath and sleep. This is by no means a luxury hotel where you would want to relax and unwind at.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of their two-bed, two-bath apartments and it was fantastic. Bathrooms were great, beds comfortable, and good linen. The kitchen area was small but perfect for us. The lounge area furniture could do with updating/replacement. Our apartment had a fantastic view of the Chrysler Building and was very special. Excellent location, and would definitely stay here again on our next trip to NYC!
reviews.title: Good Value for New York Stay

reviews.text: Location is great...walking distance to Grand Central and mid town.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.text: Lounge is also nice as is restaurant if you don;t have time to go out. Staff is friendly and accommodating.
reviews.title: Youthful and urban

reviews.text: Rooms are terribly small and furnishings are non functional as couches are hard, low backs, slippery worn leather. Also, there's a functional kitchen but NO coffee maker.
reviews.title: NYC weekend
Catch it on the Up
reviews.text: This is a nice place but it's not a 4 star and just barely hits the 3 star mark.

I stayed two nights at The Alex recently and had a good stay. The lobby is small but the fireplace made it cozy and inviting on a rainy weekend. The staff was very hospitable, helping with taxis, umbrellas, and even printing out a couple of documents I really needed printed at no cost. The room was modern and comfortable with clean white linens. White bathrobe waiting for me in the room, and even slippers, which I deeply appreciate. It might have felt a little small for two people, and there wasn't a lot of room to put much luggage there, but I enjoyed my visit. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Not worth the price, much better options in the city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very Attentive staff. Comfortable beds. They upgraded us to a 2 bedroom apartment for no additional charge. Didn't want to leave the room but who can ignore New York City....Would definetly stay here again. Special thanks to Dennis at the front desk. He was very helpful!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: I travel to New York for business several times a year. The Alex Hotel is by far the best place I have ever stayed. Rooms are amazing, service is beyond excellent, location is ideal. I really just can't think of a single bad thing to say. No complaints whatsoever, and trust me, I am VERY picky.
reviews.title: Perfect in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel based on their own web site and trip advisor reviews.
reviews.title: Compact and friendly stay at the Alex

likes.disliked: — Lobby and NYC value for money

reviews.text: Located in a very good part of mid town NYC, near Grand Central station. Plenty food, bars, shops, sites very close by etc etc. Amish market in same street was just amazing........
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: Inital reaction on arrival was lobby area felt very small. On really looking, it 'was' small but making best use of space. Not a grand traditional enterence some may expect from a "better" hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent compliment to my short stay in NYC

likes.liked: — The Service, Price and the great bed Linens
likes.disliked: — the location was a bit out of the way

description: Truly unique amongst New York City hotels, The Alex Hotel offers a stylish retreat in the heart of the city. Choose from suites with apartment style amenities including fully equipped kitchens and Manhattan skyline views. Located in Murray Hill neighborhood, just one block from Grand Central Station and within walking distance to the United Nations, Park, Madison and Fifth Avenues, The Alex Hotel was designed by residential architect Costas Kondylis, with custom designed furniture by David Rockwell and state-of-the-art amenities throughout. The Alex is perfect for those looking to explore the nightlife in Tribeca and SoHo.
